fields.value: ABC News Reagan Speech Poll, March 1987

dsDescriptionValue.value: This survey was conducted following Ronald Reagan's speech   of March 4, 1987. Respondents were asked if they had heard the   speech, and if so, whether it made them feel more confident of   Reagan's ability to lead the nation, whether it answered most of the   questions concerning Reagan's role in the Iran affair, and whether it   was an apology to the American people for the way Reagan handled the   Iran affair. Other questions probed for respondents' views on the   impact of Reagan's health and memory on his ability to carry out his   full responsibilities, and his handling of and involvement in the   Iran-contra affair in general. Demographic characteristics of  respondents are included.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XIV.C.1. Mass Political Behavior and Attitudes, Public Opinion on Political Matters, United States
